p:
Potential colonizations and extirpations vary with latitude ( Fig 5). Under RCP8.5 the proportion of potential extirpations is positively correlated with latitude in summer ( r
2 = 0.37, p < 0.0001) and winter ( r
2 = 0.23, p < 0.0001) in the contiguous U.S. The proportion of potential colonizations is positively correlated with latitude in winter only ( r
2 = 0.29, p < 0.0001). Species turnover is also significantly positively correlated with latitude in summer ( r
2 = 0.28, p < 0.0001) and winter ( r
2 = 0.31, p < 0.0001; Fig 5) in the contiguous U.S.
